body_content.explanation: relating to the growth of a thin crystal (= any solid consisting of atoms or molecules that are arranged in a regular structure) on top of another crystal, with both having a similar shape and structure:
examples: Any suitable material that allows epitaxial growth can be used as a substrate.
The substrate includes an epitaxial layer where the memory cells of the computer are located.
The atomic structure of these crystals is epitaxial in many cases.
